Drug.@name: anti-NP mAbs (influenza virus infection), Trudeau Institute
Drug.Summary: Trudeau Institute is investigating mAbs tartgeting nucleoprotein (NP), for the potential prevention and treatment of influenza virus infection [1306666], [1303366]. In June 2012, development was ongoing [1303366]; in March 2013, this was still the case [1390514]. Drug.@name: human mAbs (influenza virus infection), Trellis Bioscience
Drug.Summary: Trellis Bioscience is investigating human monoclonal antibodies (mAbs) for the potential treatment of influenza virus infection. In September 2010, the program was in lead identification [1128336]; in January 2014, this was still the case [1514900]. Drug.@name: broad-spectrum antivirals (oral, influenza virus infection), Biozone/Cocrystal
Drug.Summary: Biozone/Cocrystal, following the merger of Cocrystal Discovery with Biozone Pharmaceuticals, is investigating a program of once daily oral broad-spectrum antivirals, for the potential treatment or prevention of influenza virus infection [1203575], [1222505], [1512763].

Drug.@name: hemagglutinin/neuraminidase modulator (antibody, influenza virus infection), Biological Mimetics
Drug.Summary: Biological Mimetics is investigating a vaccine containing hemagglutinin/neuraminidase (HA/NA) modulating antibodies for the potential treatment of influenza virus infection including H3N2 [1182599], [1184248], [1049474]. In April 2011, preclinical studies were underway [1182599]; in March 2014, development was...induced viral-specific antibody production showing strong immunogenicity of the major viral structural proteins in the guinea pig model of influenza infection [1184248].

Drug.@name: vaccine (influenza virus infection), Abera Bioscience/Erasmus University Medical Center
Drug.Summary: Abera Bioscience in collaboration with Erasmus University Medical Center is investigating a vaccine, for the potential prevention of influenza virus infection. In December 2013, the drug was listed as being in preclinical development [1510596].

Drug.@name: aptamer (influenza virus infection), Weizmann
Drug.Summary: Weizmann Institute is investigating an aptamer, an oligonucleotide designed to complement the receptor-binding region of the influenza haemagglutinin, for the potential treatment of influenza virus infection [1469360]. In September 2004, data were published [1469394]. Company: Yeda Research and Development Co Ltd

Drug.@name: Virion project (influenza virus infection), Biotron
Drug.Summary: ...small-molecule inhibitors of viroporins (viral proteins with ion channel activity) for the potential treatment of influenza virus infection [758609], [1247324]. By March 2006, Biotron announced that a number of its compounds had been tested against strains of influenza; one compound showed good activity against the H5N1 strain [758609]. Drug.@name: mRNA based vaccine (influenza virus infection), Crucell / CureVac
Drug.Summary: Crucell and CureVac are investigating an mRNA-based influenza vaccine, using CureVac's RNActive technology based on its antigen sequences, for the potential prevention of influenza virus infection [1483687]. In March 2014, preclinical data were presented [1533004].In March 2014, data were...vaccine. Single administration of RNActive vaccine coding for hemagglutinin and neuraminidase of influenza in PR8-infected mice protected against disease symptoms after lethal challenge. In pigs, the...

Drug.@name: immunogenic peptides (avian influenza virus infection), NIH/NIH OTT
Drug.Summary: National Institutes of Health is investigating immunogenic peptides, including neutralizing antibodies, and polypeptides, for the potential prevention or treatment of avian influenza virus infection. In February 2012, vaccine potential of specific peptides and polypeptides was being investigated. At that time, the NIH was seeking to outlicense rights to the program through the National Institutes of Health Office of Technology Transfer [1449219], [1395222], [1456596].

Drug.@name: Carragelose + neuraminidase inhibitor (influenza virus infection), Marinomed
Drug.Summary: Marinomed is investigating a combination of Carragelose with a neuraminidase inhibitor, as intranasal spray formulation, developed using MAVIREX platform technology, for the potential treatment of influenza virus infection. In November 2012, the combination was in phase II development [1345255], [1345259]; in November 2013, this was still the case [1504803]. In November 2012, the company was seeking to outlicense the product [1345255], [1345259]; in November 2013, this was still the case [1504803].

Drug.CompanyOriginator: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases
Drug.@name: adenovector based vaccine (influenza virus infection), GenVec/NIAID
Drug.Summary: GenVec and the NIAID's Vaccine Research Center (VRC) are investigating an adenovector-based vaccine for the potential treatment of pandemic and seasonal influenza virus infection [649632]. In March 2010, preclinical development was ongoing [1083831], [1078883]; in December 2011, development was ongoing [1248119]. The vaccine was developed using the company’s 293-ORF6 production cell line and its proprietary adenovector technology [649632].

Company: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases
